oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A tunable narrowband entangled photon pair source for resonant single-photon single-atom interaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Haase, Albrecht
Piro, Nicolas
Eschner, Jürgen
Mitchell, Morgan W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present a tunable, frequency-stabilized, narrow-bandwidth source of frequency-degenerate, entangled photon pairs. The source is based on spontaneous parametric downconversion (SPDC) in periodically-poled KTiOPO4 (PPKTP). Its wavelength can be stabilized to 850 or 854 nm, thus allowing to address two D-P transitions in 40Ca+ ions. Its output bandwidth of 22 MHz coincides with the absorption bandwidth of the calcium ions. Its spectral power density is 1.0 generated pairs/(s MHz mW).
